title: How to Fix an Ice Maker in a Whirlpool Refrigerator

steps.title: The control arm is a long metal bar that spans the length.
steps.content: The control arm is a long metal bar that spans the length. When the ice tray is full, the control arm raises, and the ice maker shuts off. Make sure the control arm is lowered and there isn't any ice obstructing it and preventing it from lowering. The ice maker compartment is generally in the upper-left corner of most Whirlpool refrigerators. Press the release button and remove the ice tray to access the ice maker compartment. The ice maker may be located in a different location on a few Whirlpool refrigerator models. On some models, it may be located in the door.

steps.title: This is the ideal temperature for your Whirlpool freezer.
steps.content: This is the ideal temperature for your Whirlpool freezer. Check the inside of the ice compartment to make sure it is no higher than 10 degrees Fahrenheit. If the temperature is too warm, the ice maker may shut off automatically. If it is too cold, components of the ice maker may freeze over and stop working.

steps.title: When you slide the ice tray back into the ice maker compartment, make sure it can slide all the way in and latch shut.
steps.content: When you slide the ice tray back into the ice maker compartment, make sure it can slide all the way in and latch shut. If you cannot slide it all the way in, check to ensure there is no ice obstructing it.

steps.title: Some Whirlpool refrigerators have a shelf that the ice tray sits on.
steps.content: Some Whirlpool refrigerators have a shelf that the ice tray sits on. If this shelf is missing or placed at the wrong level, the control arm won't be able to function properly, and the ice maker may stop working or produce too much ice.

steps.title: If your Whirlpool refrigerator is not level, melted ice may not reach the drain.
steps.content: If your Whirlpool refrigerator is not level, melted ice may not reach the drain. This will result in a leaky ice maker. Use a level to make sure your refrigerator is balanced.

steps.title: Check for large ice clumps inside the ice tray.
steps.content: Check for large ice clumps inside the ice tray. If ice clumps are blocking the auger or clocking the chute, it can prevent ice from dropping. Also, make sure there is no ice blocking the ejector arm. You can clear out any ice clumps using plastic utensils or by allowing the ice maker to defrost .

steps.title: The fill tube is typically located behind the ice maker.
steps.content: The fill tube is typically located behind the ice maker. If the freezer is too cold, the fill tube may freeze over and prevent water from filling your Whirlpool ice maker's ice mold. You will need to remove the ice tray and the ice maker to access it. You can thaw it with warm water or by using a hair dryer.

steps.title: Most refrigerators have door switches that control the lights and ice maker.
steps.content: Most refrigerators have door switches that control the lights and ice maker. The switch is usually a shaft above the door or on the side. Press the door switch and make sure the lights turn off. If they do not, the door switch may need replacement. The ice maker will not turn on if the door switch is malfunctioning.

steps.title: The water line is a small plastic or copper tube that connects the water faucet to the water valve on the back of the refrigerator.
steps.content: The water line is a small plastic or copper tube that connects the water faucet to the water valve on the back of the refrigerator. Make sure it has no leaks, kinks, or clogs. Water leaking inside the freezer could be a sign of a water line leak, which would cause your ice maker to stop working. Also, make sure the faucet the water line is connected to is turned on and there is no leak where the hose connects to the spigot.

steps.title: The fill valve, which has a spigot, is near the ice tray.
steps.content: The fill valve, which has a spigot, is near the ice tray. Check to make sure the fill valve is properly aligned with the fill cup. If they are misaligned, the fill cup may not be receiving water needed to make ice. [1] X Research source

steps.title: You should change your Whirlpool water filter every 6 months.
steps.content: You should change your Whirlpool water filter every 6 months. Otherwise, sediment may build up and restrict water to the ice maker. It can also make your ice taste funny. If the water pressure is low or your ice tastes weird, it may be time to change the filter. Check the documentation that came with your refrigerator to learn where the water filter is located and how to change it. Some after-market filters may not work as well as the ones that came with your refrigerator. Make sure you get a water filter that is right for your refrigerator model.

steps.title: Ice makers have many components that can fail.
steps.content: Ice makers have many components that can fail. If you can figure out what is wrong with the ice maker, you may need to contact a repair person to fix your ice maker. It may be less expensive to replace the ice maker. You can contact a local appliance repair service or the retailer you bought the refrigerator from for a repair. You can also contact Whirlpool and schedule a repair at https://www.whirlpool.com/repair-or-replace/service.html .
